cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 155 mi ESE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn WNW then NW, cross the Yucatan Peninsula Saturday night, enter the south-central Gulf Sunday, and track toward the north-western Gulf Coast (TX-LA border) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Louisiana coast near the Texas border (roughly east of Port Arthur, TX)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm warnings currently limited to portions of Nicaragua and Honduras coastline
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area; no U.S. coastline warnings yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central America, Yucatan Peninsula, and the north-western Gulf Coast from south-central Louisiana westward toward the upper Texas coast
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤9%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (39–46 mph) late Monday into early Tuesday; gusty squalls possible if the track shifts westward
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–3 ft possible along Sabine Pass and adjacent bays if the system makes landfall just east of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 2–4 inches with localized higher totals Monday–Tuesday, which could produce brief flash-flooding in low-lying terminal areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and high waves in the approaches to Sabine/Neches channels may disrupt pilot boarding and cargo operations beginning late Sunday night
